Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory232.png'}
{1: 'Science Council', 3: 'Testing Ground'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The testing ground, once bustling day and night, was now silent, its bright lights dimmed. Asimov stands by the control panel, meticulously verifying the coordinates.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Any new discoveries?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Teddy', 3: "It's still those data walls. Ever since they appeared, they've scattered and blocked the core areas.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Even though all signs point to the possibility of opening them, I still stand by my conclusion.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "I could try to hijack them using the lower-level protocol, but Gestalt's database might activate its protection systems and get damaged.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "The code for Gestalt's foundational database has been lost in the chaos for a long time, so I can't gauge how bad the potential damage might be.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "There's a chance we could extract the technology they want, but there's also a risk of blowing up the entire foundational database.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Have they made a decision yet?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Since Gestalt still can't perform certain calculations, they're getting ready for a parliamentary vote on whether to open these data walls.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: "...It's tough to say just how low their intelligence really is.", 4: '2'}
{2: "They must think they've found a glimmer of hope.", 3: '25'}
{3: "Even knowing that what they might open is Pandora's box, knowing that the abyss ahead might store poison disguised as nectar."}
{3: "Just like the Norman Mining Corp, once obsessed with Dominik's legacy, how can those who have seen the heights of power be satisfied with the status quo?"}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'If only there was enough time...', 4: '2'}
{3: 'With enough time and our current tech, we could actually create a new "Golden Age".'}
{3: "But they can't wait any longer."}
{3: 'They cannot wait to put their glorious mark in the history book and write, "This is the decision that turns the page on humanity\'s history book, leading humanity into a new era."'}
{2: 'Teddy', 3: 'Once the Data Wall is opened, will Dominik actually show up?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Can't tell.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "No one can really assess Dominik's current state, and...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Can we even be sure it's Dominik?", 4: '1'}
{2: '..Still, are they really intent on breaking through the Data Wall?', 3: '44'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'A lot of people are in favor of it.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Even Commander Nikola from the military is on board.', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory427.jpg'}
{1: 'World Government Emergency Meeting'}
{3: 'World Government Emergency Meeting'}
{3: 'Unlike the usual clamor, the hall is enveloped in silence.'}
{3: 'Everyone senses the weight of this impromptu meeting.'}
{3: 'Is it a moment of danger or a chance for opportunity? No one can foresee the outcome; each member silently contemplates their thoughts.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: 'The briefing materials have already been distributed to you.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Hassen', 3: "I'd like to emphasize again that Chief Technician Asimov from the Science Council, Captain Karenina of the Engineering Force, and Vice-Captain Teddy are all opposed to unlocking the Data Wall in Gestalt.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A stir of whispers ripples through the attendees, but calm quickly settles over the room.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Councilor A', 3: 'So, we have indeed obtained some data on the Inver-Device from that space?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Councilor A', 3: "And we've confirmed that there's even greater space beyond the Data Wall?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Yet everything beyond that wall remains shrouded in mystery. Even a united effort from the Science Council and Engineering Force cannot reveal what lies beyond.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Next, is another crucial piece of information we must discuss.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "During the outbreak of the Punishing Virus, while relocating Gestalt, Dominik's adjutant Nithart intercepts an erroneous command sent from Gestalt.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'It is a launch order for 7295 indeterminate ballistic missiles aimed at the entire space fleet, targetingâ€”', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Babylonia.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'This information comes from Mr. Watanabe of the Forsaken.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Councilor C', 3: 'Gestalt issued an order to destroy Babylonia?!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Councilor B', 3: 'I doubt the authenticity of this information.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Councilor B', 3: "The Forsaken wouldn't want Babylonia's technology to revert to the Golden Age's level.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: "Yet the technology of the Golden Age is built on time and refinement; we don't necessarily require such drastic means to reclaim past achievements.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Do we truly have any time left?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'With the Ascendants watching us closely and the Hetero Zone spreading, can we honestly say we still have time?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "We've already sacrificed too much, warriors and resources alike.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: "The Hetero Zone may have receded for now, but who can assure us that the Red Tide won't rise again?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'When humanity is entirely confined to the Clean Zone, what will we have left to fight back with?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: 'Nikola, you know well that there may be dangers sealed behind that wall.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Nikola', 3: 'Or it could present us with a rare opportunity.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'A heavy silence hangs in the Parliament hall.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hassen', 3: '...Are there any other questions?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hassen', 3: "Then let's move forward with the vote.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory427.jpg'}

{3: 'The scholars from the Science Council who favor unlocking the Data Wall believe they can implement safety measures similar to those used in the Inver-Device experiments. They plan to create an isolation zone within Gestalt for their work.'}
{3: "If anything unexpected happens, they can quickly discard the isolation zone and protect most of Gestalt's modules."}
{3: 'Humanity has been dormant for far too long; the desire to launch a bold counterattack and reclaim the civilization that has been imprisoned is overwhelming.'}
{3: 'In the face of such irresistible temptation, no one can resist taking the bait.'}
{3: 'To return to the Golden Age and reap the long-awaited fruits of our past.'}
{3: 'The final result of the vote is too obvious to predict.'}
{2: 'Gestalt', 3: "Commander Nikola's proposal received 52.8% support, 35.1% opposition, and 12.1% abstentions."}
{2: 'Gestalt', 3: 'The proposal is approved.'}
